anuyanta：anuyanta（ti）
အနုယန္တ（တိ）
[anu+yā+a+anta]
[အနု+ယာ+အ+အန္တ]

Anuyanta，at A.V，22 is doubtful reading （v.l. anuyutta）. The meaning is either “inferior to，dependent on，a subject of，a vassal” or “attending on”. The explanation may compare Sk. anuyātaṁ attendance [anu + yā，cp. anuyāyin] or Sk. yantṛ ruler [yam]，in which latter case anu-yantṛ would be “an inferior ruler” and P. yanta would represent the n. a.g. yantā as a-stem. The v. l. is perhaps preferable as long as other passages with anuyanta are not found （see anuyutta 2）. （Page 41）

anuyanta：＂အနုယန္တ（တိ）
[အနု+ယာ+အ+အန္တ]
နောက်မှ သွားသော၊ လိုက်သော၊ ခြံရံသော၊ အနီး၌ ဖြစ်သော၊ ဆည်းကပ်-ခစား-သော။

anuyanta：အနု-ယန္တ（ပ） （အနု√ယမ်+တိ）
အဘိသိက်မသွန်းအပ်သောမင်း။
